channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Fifa to keep top seeds apart in World Cup for first time
item.description: The top four seeded countries will not be able to meet each other until the semi-finals of next year's World Cup for the first time in the tournament's history.

item.title: Ronaldo clear for World Cup opener despite red card
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo will be able to play for Portugal in their opening World Cup game despite his red card against the Republic of Ireland.

item.title: Have Premier League's most expensive signings been successful?
item.description: Which of the Premier League's most expensive signings can be considered a success, or a failure, relative to their achievements?

item.title: Gueye sent off for striking team-mate - but Moyes 'quite likes' it
item.description: Everton's Idrissa Gueye is sent off for striking team-mate Michael Keane during their Premier League victory at Manchester United.

item.title: Hampton voted BBC Women's Footballer of the Year
item.description: Chelsea and England goalkeeper Hannah Hampton is voted BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 after a superb 12 months for club and country.

item.title: 'I hope my players fight each other' - Amorim's Man Utd 'nowhere near'
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim says his side are nowhere near the level they should be after losing to 10-man Everton.

item.title: What can Slot do next to stop Liverpool slide?
item.description: BBC Sport chief football writer Phil McNulty looks at the questions Liverpool head coach Arne Slot must answer to end the crisis at Anfield.

item.title: How is Best remembered by new generations 20 years on?
item.description: On the 20th anniversary of George Best's death, how is the Northern Ireland and Manchester United legend remembered by different generations?

item.title: Boro aim to rein in soaring Sky Blues as top two meet
item.description: Championship leaders Coventry City go to second-placed Middlesbrough on Tuesday hoping to open up a 10-point lead at the top.

item.title: Ten-man Everton stun Man Utd after Gueye sees red
item.description: after Idrissa Gueye is sent off for striking a team-mate, 10-man Everton beat Manchester United to earn David Moyes his first Premier League win as a visiting manager to Old Trafford.

item.title: Hampton wins BBC Women's Footballer of the Year
item.description: England and Chelsea goalkeeper Hannah Hampton is named as BBC Women's Footballer of the Year for 2025, and receives the trophy in a surprise presentation.

item.title: Eze hits hat-trick as Arsenal thrash Tottenham
item.description: Eberechi Eze scores a hat-trick to help Arsenal thump rivals Tottenham 4-1 and go six points clear at the top of the Premier League - despite a moment of magic from Richarlison.

item.title: Rogers nets twice as Villa come from behind to beat Leeds
item.description: Morgan Rogers scores a second-half double as Aston Villa fight back to beat Leeds 2-1 at Elland Road and leave Daniel Farke's side in the relegation zone.

item.title: Forest inflict stunning defeat on Liverpool at Anfield
item.description: Goals by Murillo, Nicolo Savona and Morgan Gibbs-White condemn Liverpool to their sixth defeat in seven Premier League games as Nottingham Forest put on a brilliant display to win 3-0 at Anfield.

item.title: Barnes fires Newcastle to victory against Man City
item.description: Harvey Barnes scores twice as Newcastle put a dent in Manchester City's title charge and grab three points in the Premier League at St James' Park.

item.title: Neto and Fernandez give Chelsea win at Burnley
item.description: Goals from Pedro Neto and Enzo Fernandez give Chelsea a 2-0 victory against Burnley at Turf Moor.

item.title: Palace into top four as Edwards loses first game as Wolves boss
item.description: Crystal Palace comfortably beat Wolverhampton Wanderers to move into fourth in the Premier League and condemn Rob Edwards to a defeat in his first game in charge at Wolves.

item.title: 'I like when my players fight' - Moyes backs Gueye after red card
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes defends Idrissa Gueye after the midfielder was sent off following an altercation with team-mate Michael Keane, admitting he likes to see his players "brawl" with each other to show they care.

item.title: 'You don't want anyone fighting' - Hart on Gueye red card
item.description: Former England goalkeeper Joe Hart reacts to Everton duo Idrissa Gueye and Michael Keane's clash at Manchester United on BBC Radio 5 Live's Monday Night Club.

item.title: 'Forget the result' - Amorim concerned for Man Utd after defeat
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim says he is concerned by the performance of his players after losing 1-0 at home to Everton.

item.title: When team-mates fight - Dyer v Bowyer
item.description: BBC Sport looks back at team-mates Lee Bowyer and Kieron Dyer coming to blows during Newcastle's 3-0 loss to Aston Villa at St James' Park on 2 April 2005.

item.title: Will Chelsea wonderkid Estevao hit heights of Yamal?
item.description: As the two most valuable teenagers in world football come head-to-head, can Chelsea's Estevao reach the levels of Lamine Yamal?

item.title: Can you complete these XIs from European matches?
item.description: Can you finish these classic Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool, Manchester City, Newcastle and Tottenham line-ups?

item.title: Scotland women 'inspired' by men reaching World Cup
item.description: Scotland qualifying for their first men's World Cup in 28 years has "inspired" the women to do the same for the 2027 finals, says head coach Melissa Andreatta.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: Man Utd and Liverpool monitor Vinicius - Tuesday's gossip
item.description: Vinicius Junior will not sign a new contract at Real Madrid, while Liverpool have held concrete talks over a move for Antoine Semenyo.

item.title: Celtic close to appointing Nancy as new manager
item.description: Columbus Crew's Wilfried Nancy is close to being appointed Celtic manager.

item.title: Memorable team-mate bust-ups after Gueye red card
item.description: BBC Sport has a look at some other scraps between footballing team-mates after Idrissa Gueye's red card for hitting Michael Keane.

item.title: Tearful Paul Doyle in court over parade charges
item.description: Paul Doyle faces 31 charges after his car struck pedestrians during Liverpool FC's victory parade.

item.title: Rangers sack CEO Stewart & sporting director Thelwell
item.description: Rangers remove chief executive Patrick Stewart and sporting director Kevin Thelwell from their posts with immediate effect.

item.title: Guardiola 'embarrassed and ashamed' of behaviour
item.description: Pep Guardiola says he is sorry for confronting a cameraman following Manchester City's Premier League defeat at Newcastle on Saturday.

item.title: 'Salah not helping' - Rooney calls for Slot to make 'big' decision
item.description: Mohamed Salah should be dropped by Arne Slot, amid Liverpool's poor form, says former Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney.

item.title: Barcelona respond to Boateng visit backlash
item.description: Barcelona say they are "fully committed to combating gender-based violence" after criticism for a visit to the club by Jerome Boateng.

item.title: MPs want answers on Villa-Maccabi game intelligence
item.description: Ministers ask West Midlands Police for more details on Israeli fans' ban at the match on 6 November.

item.title: 'McBarnes has a ring to it' - do Scotland need Newcastle winger?
item.description: BBC Scotland examines the possibility of Newcastle winger Harvey Barnes becoming part of the Scotland squad.

item.title: Manager Imrie leaves Morton for Raith Rovers
item.description: Dougie Imrie is appointed Raith Rovers manager on a two-and-a-half year contract after leaving Greenock Morton.

item.title: Klopp's 'connector' - who is new Swansea boss Matos?
item.description: Inspired by Jose Mourinho, known as Jurgen Klopp's 'connector' at Liverpool, backed by Luka Modric, now Vitor Matos has the challenge of becoming his own man at Swansea City.

item.title: Homeless in Abidjan to World Cup hope via Hackney Marshes - rise of QPR's Kone
item.description: Richard Kone was homeless at 16, playing non-league football fewer than two years ago and now he could be going to the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: Slot needs to make 'huge decisions' and leave 'some big players out' - Murphy
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Joe Hart discuss what Arne Slot needs to do moving forward to get Liverpool out of a tricky time in the Premier League.

item.title: How Eze shone for Arsenal in derby debut
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy discusses how Arsenal forward Eberechi Eze shone in his North London derby debut.

item.title: Rogers' 'confusing' but 'special' free-kick technique
item.description: Match of the Day pundit and former goalkeeper Joe Hart looks at Morgan Rogers' 'confusing' but 'special' free-kick technique.

item.title: Arsenal 'dominated every part of the game' - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta praises Eberechi Eze's all-round play after a dominant performance from his side in the North London derby at The Emirates.

item.title: What is going on with offside, and can it be fixed?
item.description: After more controversy with subjective offside in the Premier League this weekend, can anything be done to change it?

item.title: Premier League clubs urged to freeze ticket prices
item.description: More than 100 fan groups urge Premier League clubs to freeze home ticket prices for the next two seasons.

item.title: Newcastle, PSG, Real Madrid... full kits and a London park
item.description: They are representing some of Europe's top clubs in full kits on a park in central London, where the real winners are friendship, identity and belonging.

item.title: Dyslexia helped me as a professional footballer - Lescott
item.description: Ex-England and Wolves player Joleon Lescott recalls his experiences as a charity launches a course.

item.title: 'Why things will never be same again for super-talented Eze'
item.description: MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains why Eberechi Eze will be walking on air for a few days after his hat-trick for Arsenal against Tottenham - and things will be different further ahead too.

item.title: Rogers 'only getting better' - will he win England battle?
item.description: After his double against Leeds, can Morgan Rogers win the battle for England's number 10 role over Jude Bellingham, Phil Foden and Cole Palmer?

item.title: A 'special day' for Eze - but can anyone challenge Arsenal for title?
item.description: After Eberechi Eze's hat-trick helps Arsenal to a 4-1 win against Tottenham, BBC Sport takes a closer look at the Gunners' title challenge.

item.title: Leeds fans divided - but Farke defiant as pressure mounts
item.description: If Daniel Farke is heading towards the exit door as Leeds manager, he is determined to go down swinging and on his own terms.

item.title: Watch Ronaldo score stunning overhead kick
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo, 40, rolls back the years with a stunning overhead kick in Al-Nassr's 4-1 win over Al-Khaleej in the Saudi Pro League.

item.title: Why VAR offside images are not always what they seem
item.description: When the Premier League rolled out semi-automated offside technology we thought we would lose the rows about offside.

item.title: Are Hibs quietly building another good season?
item.description: BBC Scotland's Nick McPheat analyses the numbers behind Hibernian's promising Scottish Premiership form.

item.title: How Forest tactically exposed Liverpool
item.description: BBC Sport looks at how Nottingham Forest exposed Liverpool's tactical flaws in their 3-0 win at Anfield.

item.title: Why it was always Arsenal for 'part-time barista' Saka
item.description: England winger Bukayo Saka sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his love for Arsenal and living in his "coffee era".

item.title: Are you not being entertained? The decline of the open-play goal
item.description: Open-play goals have been on the decline this season and BBC Sport takes a closer look at the trend.

item.title: Have we seen the last of Wales and ex-Arsenal star Ramsey?
item.description: Wales captain Aaron Ramsey has no club and has not played for his country for 14 months, so where and what next for the ex-Arsenal midfielder?

item.title: How does Arsenal defence compare to Premier League's best?
item.description: Where do Arsenal's back four rank in terms of the best ever in the Premier League?

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why is Crystal Palace v Man Utd at noon on Sunday?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Manchester United's trip to Selhurst Park has an unusual kick-off time

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: Why are Man Utd not playing on a Saturday for two months?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why Manchester United are not playing on a Saturday for two months

item.title: Who is not going to the 2026 World Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at which countries and players will not be competing at the 2026 World Cup

item.title: What is Scotland's World Cup record?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at how Scotland have fared in previous World Cup competitions.

item.title: Who has qualified for World Cup and when is draw?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore when the World Cup draw is, how the seeding works and who has qualified so far.

item.title: Why VAR gets involved in some penalties but not others
item.description: It was a weekend of VAR penalty decisions in the Premier League, with spot-kicks awarded, cancelled and ignored. BBC Sport explains why.

item.title: 'Nancy to target Palestine striker as Celtic boss' - gossip
item.description: There is plenty of speculation about who might follow Wilfried Nancy from Columbus Crew should he be named Celtic manager, while David Weir is tipped to become Rangers sporting director.

item.title: Sir Alex Ferguson launches new university scholarship
item.description: The ex-Manchester United manager and a leading businessman are behind the Glasgow Caledonian University scheme.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Drenthe's manager confident of 'successful recovery' from stroke
item.description: Royston Drenthe's manager remains confident the former Real Madrid and Everton winger will make "a successful recovery" after his stroke.

item.title: Rice, Yamal and Brentford women's goal among Puskas & Marta nominees
item.description: Brentford women's Ashley Cheatley is included alongside Declan Rice and Lamine Yamal on Fifa's shortlist for the best goals of the past year.

item.title: Real's Endrick closes in on Lyon loan
item.description: Real Madrid are in advanced talks with Lyon over sending 19-year-old forward Endrick on loan to the Ligue 1 side in January.

item.title: Meet the man who played in two games, in two countries... in one day
item.description: BBC Sport tells the story of Soren Lerby, who once played for Denmark and Bayern Munich on the same day - in different countries.

item.title: Turkish FA bans 102 players in betting probe
item.description: Turkey's Football Federation gives bans to 102 players from its top two divisions for "betting-related activities".

item.title: Women's sport governing bodies and leagues call for tax relief
item.description: Governing bodies and leagues call on the government to introduce tax relief for the live broadcast production of women's sports.

item.title: McAneny called up by Scotland women for first time
item.description: Celtic midfielder Maria McAneny has been called up by Scotland women for the first time for the friendly matches with Ukraine and China.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
